metadata.title: King's Speech
metadata.description: Statistics and analysis of the Danish Monarch's New Year's Eve speeches

home.subHeader: Is Frederik X going to say
home.searchPrompt: Search for any word to see its usage across the years, or explore the odds for commonly bet-upon words.

word.neverMentioned: This word was never mentioned in any speech.

odds.neverMentioned: This word was never mentioned in any speech.

oddsList.title: Betting Odds
oddsList.description: Words commonly bet upon during the New Year's Eve speech, sorted by likelihood (lower odds = more likely).
oddsList.oddsExplanation: Lower odds indicate higher likelihood. Checkmarks show whether the word was mentioned in that year's speech.

wordsList.title: Words
wordsList.description: Explore the most frequently used words in the Danish Monarch's New Year's Eve speeches.
wordsList.stopwordsTooltip: Stopwords are common words like 'the', 'and', 'of' that appear frequently in all texts
wordsList.mostUsedDescription: Words with the highest total mention count across all speeches.
wordsList.mostSpeechesDescription: Words that appear in the largest number of different speeches.

timeline.hoverPrompt: Tap/hover over a year to see details
timeline.hoverPromptDesktop: Hover/tap a year to see details

decades.title: Decades
decades.description: Explore the most distinctive words from each decade of royal New Year's Eve speeches.
decades.aboutDescription: These signature words are the most distinctive for each decade compared to all other decades. They reveal the unique themes, concerns, and vocabulary of each era.
decades.aboutMethod: Rankings are based on Weighted Log-Odds with Informative Dirichlet Prior, a statistical method that identifies words that are significantly more common in one time period compared to others.

monarchs.title: Monarchs
monarchs.description: Compare the linguistic styles of different Danish monarchs through their signature words.
monarchs.aboutDescription: These signature words are the most distinctive for each monarch compared to all other monarchs. They reflect each monarch's unique voice, priorities, and era.
monarchs.aboutMethod: Rankings are based on Weighted Log-Odds with Informative Dirichlet Prior, a statistical method that identifies words that are significantly more common in one monarch's speeches compared to others.
